importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Kada Scott was reported missing on this date after leaving an overnight shift at an assisted living facility. The stolen Hyundai Accent was reported stolen the same day and later found on fire, linking it to the investigation.
This date marks when the Hyundai vehicle was found on fire in Philadelphia and subsequently compacted at a junkyard, which became a key piece of evidence in the case.
This is when the remains of Kada Scott were discovered behind an abandoned school, and authorities publicly confirmed the identity through DNA testing and announced new charges against Keon King.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame of the theft and fire involving the Hyundai Accent, which occurred on or around Oct. 4, is central to the timeline of Scott’s disappearance and the evidence linking Keon King to the crime.

keyTakeAways: Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman, was found dead in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia after being missing for about two weeks.
Authorities discovered the remains following an anonymous tip that directed them to re-examine the area previously searched.

Keon King, 21, of Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, causing or risking a catastrophe, conspiracy, and possible homicide. His bail was set at $2.5 million.
DNA testing confirmed the identity of the remains as Kada Scott.
A black Hyundai Accent was reported stolen the day before Scott disappeared and was seen parked near the recreation center where her body was found, with video evidence linking the vehicle to King.
The vehicle was later found on fire and compacted at a junkyard, hindering forensic examination.
King previously had a prior case involving kidnapping and assault, but charges were dropped due to lack of witness attendance.
Prosecutors say there may be additional individuals involved in the case, and investigations into those connections are ongoing.
District Attorney Larry Krasner stated that while homicide charges are expected, they will follow legal procedures and not take shortcuts.
Kada Scott’s parents described her as a source of light, kindness, and a beautiful spirit, and expressed deep emotional pain over her disappearance and death.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The remains of 23-year-old missing woman Kada Scott were discovered in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia after an anonymous tip led investigators to re-examine the area. DNA testing confirmed her identity. Keon King, a 21-year-old from Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and possibly homicide. Evidence including a stolen black Hyundai Accent seen parked near the site of discovery and video footage linking King to Scott’s disappearance strengthens the case. Prosecutors say more charges are in development and that others may be involved. King previously faced dropped charges in a prior kidnapping case. Kada Scott’s parents expressed deep sorrow, describing her as a source of light and kindness.
